creator: cedric.couralet@gmail.com
text:
Created attachment 29853
Trivial patch for triming the value before parsing

When using tomcat as a service on windows, and configuring JMX with JMXRemoteLifeCycleListener via the JVM options tab, if a trailing space is present then java parses it as false which could lead to a potential vulnerability.

I made a trivial patch for tomcat trunk (taking only space into account), but i'm not sure if it should be declared as a commons-daemon bug ?

I can make a patch to assure the value is true if one of a property *.jmx.remote.file.access or *.jmx.remote..file.password is present which should probably be better but could potentially have side effect.

creator: markt@apache.org
text:
There are 200+ places where Tomcat reads system properties - a fair proportion of which are potentially user configurable.

If this is fixed, it should be fixed generally. However since this does not appear to be a widespread problem and a global change would be considerable effort I don't believe the benefit is worth the required effort.
